text: Bill Leak (born Desmond Robert Leak; 9 January 1956 – 10 March 2017) was an Australian editorial cartoonist, caricaturist and portraitist. Leak was raised in Condobolin and Beacon Hill, Sydney. Leak studied at the Julian Ashton Art School in the 1970s. Leak's cartoons were first published in 1983 in The Bulletin and after he drew for The Sydney Morning Herald until 1994, when he was recruited by News Limited to contribute to The Daily-Telegraph-Mirror and later to The Australian. On 10 March 2017, Leak died in a hospital in Gosford, New South Wales following a suspected heart attack. He was 61 years old. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Drawing and quartering our pollies – Article includes comments by Bill Leak on his cartooning and the reactions he gets * Portrait of Bill Leak, editorial cartoonist, 1984, by Terry Mulligan Category:1956 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Australian cartoonists Category:People from Adelaide
title: Bill Leak
